keyword.name: azimuth
keyword.description: The CSS azimuth property is an aural property that helps you create surround sound on audio devices.

keyword.name: left-side
keyword.description: Same as '270deg'. With 'behind', '270deg'.

keyword.name: far-left
keyword.description: Same as '300deg'. With 'behind', '240deg'.

keyword.name: left
keyword.description: Same as '320deg'. With 'behind', '220deg'.

keyword.name: center-left
keyword.description: Same as '340deg'. With 'behind', '200deg'.

keyword.name: center
keyword.description: Same as '0deg'. With 'behind', '180deg'.

keyword.name: center-right
keyword.description: Same as '20deg'. With 'behind', '160deg'.

keyword.name: right
keyword.description: Same as '40deg'. With 'behind', '140deg'.

keyword.name: far-right
keyword.description: Same as '60deg'. With 'behind', '120deg'.

keyword.name: right-side
keyword.description: Same as '90deg'. With 'behind', '90deg'.

keyword.name: leftwards
keyword.description: Moves the sound to the left, relative to the current angle - it subtracts 20 degrees.

keyword.name: rightwards
keyword.description: Moves the sound to the right, relative to the current angle - it adds 20 degrees.

keyword.name: background
keyword.description: The CSS background property is a shorthand property for setting the background of an HTML element. This enables you to set all your background properties with one property.

keyword.name: background-attachment
keyword.description: The CSS background-attachment property specifies whether a background image should be fixed or scroll with the containing block.

keyword.name: background-color
keyword.description: The CSS background-color property is for setting the background color of an element.

keyword.name: background-image
keyword.description: The CSS background-image property is used to specify a background image of an element.

keyword.name: background-position
keyword.description: The CSS background-position property is used to position a background image.

keyword.name: background-repeat
keyword.description: The CSS background-repeat property is used to specify if a background image repeats (tiles) or not, and how it should repeat (hence css

keyword.name: repeat
keyword.description: background repeats both horizontally and vertically

keyword.name: repeat-x
keyword.description: background repeats horizontally only

keyword.name: repeat-y
keyword.description: background repeats vertically only

keyword.name: no-repeat
keyword.description: background is not repeated

keyword.name: border
keyword.description: The CSS border property is CSS shorthand for setting all styles on the borders of an element.

keyword.name: border-collapse
keyword.desciption: The CSS border-collapse property allows you to collapse a table's border. It can have an effect similar to HTML's cellpadding (except that technically, border-collapse makes the border 'collapse' rather than simply adjust the padding).

keyword.name: border-color
keyword.description:
The CSS border-color property allows you to set the border color of a box.
You can also use border-top-color, border-bottom-color, border-left-color, and border-right-color if you only want to specify a border color for some sides (but not all sides) of your box.
Note: You will also need to specify border-style and border-width before your border-color is displayed.
